alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 10 at 5:46AM PDT until April 11 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM PDT MONDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy, wet snow accumulations expected above 2500 feet of 4 to 8 inches, with accumulations up to 15 inches possible at higher elevations. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...South Central Douglas County along the Umpqua Divide including a short portion of Highway 227 near Tiller and I-5 including Canyon Creek Pass. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 11 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Although Camas Mountain on Highway 42 and Canyon Mountain Pass on I-5 are not included in the advisory, around 10 AM Monday peak snowfall is expected where gusty winds and snow accumulations up to 2 inches could increase slippery road conditions and blowing snow may reduce visibility. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
